meanings.definition: To heat (metal or glass) and then cool it slowly in order to toughen it.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith carefully annealed the sword to make it strong and durable.
meanings.sent2: The glassblower annealed the delicate vase to prevent it from shattering easily.
meanings.sent3: After a long day at work, the metalworker joked that he needed to anneal himself to handle the stress.
meanings.sent4: The friendship between the two neighbors was annealed through shared experiences and mutual support.
meanings.sent5: The idea was annealed in his mind, becoming stronger and more defined with each passing day.
